title: Recognize the Standard Equation of Circle
text: The equation is in the form of $${\left(x-h\right)}^2+{\left(y-k\right)}^2=r^2$$ which is the standard form of a circle with center at (h,k). In this case $$r=3$$. Therefore the equation represents the circle centered at $$(2,3)$$ with radius $$3$$.\n##figure1.gif##
speech: The equation is in the form of  parentheses x minus h,  squared plus, parentheses y minus k,  squared is equal to, r squared  which is the standard form of a circle with center at (h,k). In this case  r, is equal to 3 . Therefore the equation represents the circle centered at , parentheses 2 comma 3,   with radius  3 .\n##figure1.gif##
